LaTeX-friendly string interpolation

Source: R/compile_problem.R
compile_text.Rd

Wrapper for the glue::glue_data() function with more LaTeX- and raw-string-friendly defaults.

Usage

compile_text(
  text,
  vars = parent.frame(),
  open = "<<",
  close = ">>",
  trim = FALSE
)

Arguments

text

string Input template string.

vars

listish List or environment containing variables to make available for string interpolation. Defaults to parent.frame().

open

string Opening delimiter. Defaults to "<<".

close

string Closing delimiter. Defaults to ">>".

trim

logical Whether to trim text with glue::trim() or not. Unlike glue::glue(), defaults to FALSE.

Value

A glue object.

Examples

details <- list(name = "Michael", subject="statistics")
compile_text("My name is <<name>>, and I teach <<subject>>.", vars = details)
#> My name is Michael, and I teach statistics.

setup <- list(ex = 3)
compile_text(
  r"(The derivative of $\pm C x^<<ex>>$ is $\pm <<ex>> C x^<<ex-1>>$)",
  vars = setup)
#> The derivative of $\pm C x^3$ is $\pm 3 C x^2$
